Ad Text:
Working at Atlassian

Atlassians can choose where they work – whether in an office, from home, or a combination of the two. That way, Atlassians have more control over supporting their family, personal goals, and other priorities. We can hire people in any country where we have a legal entity.

About our Team


The Workplace team is responsible for driving Atlassian’s global footprint, workplace programs, gatherings, and office experience strategies through partnerships and collaboration with all business functions.

About the Role


As the Workplace Data and Tooling Specialist, you will play a crucial role in supporting the operational delivery of our Workplace Teams and cross-functional partners, including Engineering. This role oversees data, tools, and workflows to support efficient office operations, provide insights, and enable data-driven decisions across Atlassian Central, Engineering, and Workplace.

This position is office-based in Sydney, Australia. You will report to the Head of Workplace Programs located in Sydney. This role is considered office-based; see Atlassian’s office-based roles policy.

Join us in shaping the future of work at Atlassian. Apply now to be part of a team that values innovation, collaboration, and making a difference!

We're looking for a detail-oriented, organised pro who loves using technology to boost operations and meet the changing needs of employees and stakeholders. Success here means working closely with Data Engineering, Finance, and People teams. In this role, you'll be responsible for:

Developing metrics and ongoing reporting to support real estate decisions and design initiatives (portfolio balancing, footprint expansion/contraction, space programming).

Using data visualisation, statistics, and storytelling to answer business questions; build scalable insights using Tableau, Looker, and Databricks.

Developing cross-functional partnerships with finance and engineering teams to ensure data quality and reporting outputs; consult with data engineers on scalable data infrastructure.

Independently managing our portfolio of reports and dashboards, including operational dashboards (utilisation, occupancy, cost metrics), Office Pulse surveys, and program-specific reporting such as Atlassian on Tour and Team Camp.

Designing, automating, and optimising our Jira Service Management (JSM) ticket classification workflows.

Compiling and delivering data for quarterly People Insights Executive Operations reports.

Identifying gaps and executing solutions for reporting and insights; maintain data quality while integrating new data sources into SQL/Databricks and BI layers.

Your Background


5–7 years in analytics, BI, or operations, with hands-on experience building metrics and reporting for portfolio or workplace programs.

Proficient with Tableau and SQL; exposure to Databricks or similar data platforms; comfortable joining data across sources and ensuring data quality.

Experience building automated dashboards for utilisation, occupancy, cost metrics, and survey insights (e.g., Office Pulse).

Ability to translate complex analyses into clear, compelling narratives for non-technical stakeholders and leadership.

Working knowledge of statistics and data storytelling; capable of recommending actions grounded in evidence.

Experience designing and optimising workflows in Jira Service Management (e.g., ticket classification and automation).

Demonstrated cross-functional collaboration with Finance, Data Engineering, and People teams; able to balance ad‑hoc requests with planned deliverables.

Strong communication skills and stakeholder management; comfortable operating in a distributed, fast-paced environment.

Nice to have: familiarity with Looker, Python or R for analysis, and experience supporting large human resource and workplace programs.

Benefits & Perks

Atlassian offers a wide range of perks and benefits designed to support you, your family and to help you engage with your local community. Our offerings include health and wellbeing resources, paid volunteer days, and so much more. To learn more, visit go.atlassian.com/perksandbenefits.

About Atlassian

At Atlassian, we're motivated by a common goal: to unleash the potential of every team. Our software products help teams all over the planet and our solutions are designed for all types of work. Team collaboration through our tools makes what may be impossible alone, possible together.

We believe that the unique contributions of all Atlassians create our success. To ensure that our products and culture continue to incorporate everyone's perspectives and experience, we never discriminate based on race, religion, national origin, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, or marital, veteran, or disability status. All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

To provide you the best experience, we can support with accommodations or adjustments at any stage of the recruitment process. Simply inform our Recruitment team during your conversation with them.

To learn more about our culture and hiring process, visit go.atlassian.com/crh.

Grant Thornton Australia is one of the world's leading independently-owned and managed accounting, advisory and consulting firms.

Our culture is underpinned by a commitment to our clients, people and communities, and our promise to ‘Reach for Remarkable’ by providing proven expertise, principled execution, and personalised experience.

In Australia, we’re proud to support the careers of over 1,500 remarkable people. With six offices nationally and partner firms in more than 145 markets, wherever you want to go, we can take you there.

About this role

Join our innovative Digital Team as a Senior Data Analyst and embark on a journey where your skills in data modelling, integration and analysis will be pivotal in shaping our business landscape. This permanent, full-time position sits within our Applications, Data and Integration team, and offers the unique opportunity to collaborate with a close-knit team of experts, including Data Scientists, BI Specialists and Application Specialists. Building on our greenfield data environment, your contributions will leave a lasting impact as you implement data models and pipelines that support meaningful and actionable analytics, helping to drive positive change with an engaged and supportive business.  

Key responsibilities

Partner with stakeholders across the business to gather data and reporting requirements, and translate them into effective, scalable analytics solutions. 

Build and maintain clean, reliable datasets using SQL and Python within Databricks, supporting both operational reporting and strategic analysis. 

Develop and deliver insightful dashboards and reports using Power BI to help drive data-informed decisions. 

Use Python/pySpark in Databricks to automate data preparation, analysis, and reporting workflows. 

Support the development and improvement of data pipelines and processes in collaboration with other data specialists, ensuring data is accurate, timely, and accessible. 

Work with cloud-based data platforms, particularly within Microsoft Azure. Collaborate with engineering team members to ensure data solutions are secure, reliable, and well-integrated. 

Skills & experience

Advanced SQL skills for querying and transforming large datasets across various sources. 

Proficiency in Python/pySpark, particularly in the context of Databricks, for data manipulation, analysis, and automation. 

Hands-on experience working in Databricks, including familiarity with notebooks, workflows, and collaborative data development. 

Strong experience building dashboards and data models in Power BI or similar BI tools. 

Comfortable working with cloud-based data platforms, ideally within Azure. 

Ability to collaborate with both technical teams and non-technical stakeholders to deliver data solutions that meet business needs. 

Familiarity with data best practices, including governance, quality, and documentation. 

If you’re interested in this role but don’t feel that you match every single one of our requirements, we would still love to hear from you and explore the unique skillset and attributes that you can bring to the team. 

Reach your remarkable

At Grant Thornton we do things differently because we understand that when you strive for better and care about what you do remarkable things are possible. We’re a dynamic and authentic mix of backgrounds, perspectives and ways of thinking. We’re driven by our shared purpose – we care for our people, clients and communities and support them to thrive.

With us, you’ll be exposed to challenging and rewarding opportunities – building your confidence and capabilities at every step. You’ll be supported, motivated and inspired by a team of passionate and caring collaborators and leaders. You’ll be empowered to build a career path that’s tailored to you and encouraged to make a meaningful difference. And we’ll make sure the excellence you deliver and the impact you make is always seen, felt and celebrated.

Remarkable perks that put you first:

Work from home options | team connection days

9-day fortnight with no salary reduction

Fully funded gym membership | Health Insurance discounts

Work in comfort and dress for your day

And many more!

Need some help applying or participating in the recruitment process?

We are committed to ensuring our recruitment process is inclusive and accessible for anyone who wishes to apply, and we warmly encourage applications from individuals from diverse backgrounds including Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islanders, those in the LGBTQI+ community and individuals who identify as having disability or are neurodivergent.  Click here for recruitment support information and to learn more about Diversity, Equity and Inclusion at Grant Thornton.


Should you have questions or require any adaptations or additional support for your individual circumstances so you may perform at your best during the application or recruitment process please contact our Talent Acquisition team at gttalentscouts@au.gt.com

As we provide fair consideration and evaluation to a high volume of applications, we endeavour to provide feedback on your application at the earliest opportunity.
